business.headline: Sensex ends 106 points higher, Nifty above 24,400; Tata Motors jumps 5%The BSE Sensex was up 105.71 points higher to 80,746.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 34.80 points to settle at 24,414.40. Most of the broader market indices also recovered after falling in early trade.

HDFC Bank trims these lending rates from May 7. Will your EMIs go down?This move comes shortly after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut the repo rate by 25 bps in April, taking the total cut to 50 bps since February 2025.

Operation Sindoor: Should Dalal Street investors worry about what's next?There was no sell-off, no bloodbath, just a bit of volatility. For many retail investors, the calm felt unusual — shouldn't a military flare-up between nuclear neighbours spook the markets? But past data suggests otherwise.

Taking a personal loan for a wedding? Here are 6 key tips to keep in mindWeddings can tempt us to go overboard, but it's best to plan a realistic budget. See where you can cut costs or use your savings first. Borrow just the amount you really need, don't take a bigger loan just because you're eligible for it.

Filing ITR? Here's how to choose the right tax regimeWhile the new regime offers reduced tax slabs, it doesn't let you claim the usual deductions available under the old regime. It's lower rates, but with fewer tax-saving options.

Whisky, cars, and jobs: Inside India's game-changing UK free trade pactThe India-UK trade deal holds significance in a world drifting back toward trade barriers and tariff wars. With Trump-era protectionism rearing its head again, the timing of this pact couldn't be better.
PwC to cut 1,500 jobs in the US: ReportLast year, PwC was in the news for possibly cutting half of its auditing staff in China's financial services sector.

Pakistan's Karachi Stock Exchange crashes nearly 6% after 'Operation Sindoor'The Karachi Stock Exchange 100 index (KSE-100) plunged 6,272 points in early trade, sliding to 107,296.64 — a sharp drop from Tuesday's close of 113,568.51.

Explained: Why Info Edge shares look like they've crashed 80% todayInfo Edge shares traded ex-split today after the company carried out a 1:5 stock split, its first since its 2006 listing. As a result, each share with a face value of Rs 10 has been subdivided into five shares of Rs 2 each.

Explained: Why foreign portfolio investors are buying Indian financial stocksData from the National Securities Depository shows FPIs bought Rs 18,409 crore ($2.18 billion) worth of shares in the sector last month, propelling the Nifty Financial Services index to a 4.1% gain.

Scotch whisky prices set to drop after India-UK trade deal. Details hereThe reduction is expected to bring premium and mid-range Scotch whiskies within reach of a larger section of Indian consumers. A bottle that typically costs Rs 5,000 could soon be priced between Rs 3,500 and Rs 4,000 following the initial tariff cut.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market didn't crash after 'Operation Sindoor'While markets remain extremely volatile, swinging between green and red, there was no major crash. Here are three reasons why Dalal Street remained calm after 'Operation Sindoor'.

entertainment.headline: Maharashtra government announces a biopic on AhilyabaiThe Maharashtra government will make a film on Ahilyabai Holkar's life for her 300th birth anniversary in 2025. The movie will be shown on Doordarshan and OTT platforms in Marathi and other languages.

Junior artiste dies by drowning on Rishab Shetty's Kantara 2 setsRishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has consistently faced several problems during its production. Now, a junior artiste from Kerala died by drowning on the sets of the highly anticipated film on Tuesday afternoon.

Mammootty, Allu Arjun, Mohanlal, celebs salute Indian forces for Operation SindoorFrom Mammootty and Mohanlal to Kichcha Sudeep and Samantha, celebrities across Indian cinema praised the Armed Forces and expressed solidarity following India's counterstrike on terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

Exclusive: Suniel Shetty defends patriotism in cinema amid 'propaganda' debatesBollywood actor Suniel Shetty discusses the significance of patriotism in cinema, particularly through historical films like 'Kesari Veer'. Amid debates on propaganda in films, Shetty emphasises unity and empathy, asserting that such stories aim to celebrate and protect India's diverse history without inciting division.

Exclusive: Neil Nitin Mukesh regrets rejecting a role in BerlinNeil Nitin Mukesh expresses regret over not taking a role in the film 'Berlin', realising its potential only after watching it. He attributes his decision to prior commitments and concerns about age-drafting for another project.

Shehzad Khan opens up about strained relationship with father AjitActor Shehzad Khan opened up about his tough and distant relationship with his father, famous Bollywood villain Ajit, and the struggles he faced growing up in his shadow. Even without any support from his father, Shehzad made his own way in the film industry without using his father's name.

Conclave OTT release: Ralph Fiennes's film starts streaming in IndiaThe political thriller 'Conclave', starring Ralph Fiennes, is now streaming in India on Prime Video. The film delves into the clandestine papal election, revealing dark Vatican secrets.

Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock to reunite after Speed for a romantic thrillerKeanu Reeves and Sandra Bullock are reuniting for a new romantic thriller, marking their first collaboration in nearly 30 years. The film, produced by Mark Gordon, promises a fast-paced and emotionally charged narrative.

Janhvi Kapoor reacts to trolls saying Indians are 'Chandivalification of Met'Actor Janhvi Kapoor hit back at trolls mocking Indian celebrities at the Met Gala 2025, calling out classist and colonial mindsets. She praised Indian designers and celebrities for finally getting the global recognition they long deserved.

Allu Arjun meets Aamir Khan at his residence, viral photo sparks collab rumours'Pushpa' actor Allu Arjun recently visited Bollywood actor Aamir Khan at his residence. After a photo from the meeting went viral, fans began speculating that the superstars might be collaborating on a pan-India project soon.

Sidharth-Janhvi's Param Sundari teaser to be attached with Bhool Chuk MaafThe highly-awaited teaser of 'Param Sundar' will release on May 9, but there is a catch. The promo will not be available for immediate viewing anywhere on the internet.

Shah Rukh Khan says Met Gala is not his 'space' in 1st post after his grand debutShah Rukh Khan shared a few more photos of his Met Gala look on social media, and called the event not his 'space' in the caption. He thanked his team for making him feel 'comfortable' about the entire experience.

Jackson Wang, Diljit Dosanjh ask 'do you wanna dance' in 1st collaboration. WatchGlobal icons Jackson Wang and Diljit Dosanjh have teamed up for a new single, Buck. The teaser is out now, promising a genre-defying collaboration that blends their unique styles.

Hina Khan reacts to Nishat sexual assault case, says rape can never be justifiedHina Khan took to Instagram to share her thoughts on the recent sexual assault and murder in Nishat, Srinagar. She emphasised the importance of distinguishing between rape and sexual assault and urged coexistence among communities.

Karan Johar says he's battling body dysmorphia: Can't even look myself in mirrorKaran Johar spoke about having insecurities with his body. He said he has a condition which makes him dislike his own body, but he's aware of the issues and working on them.

Jailer 2 director's meeting with Mohanlal sparks cameo rumoursDirector Nelson Dilipkumar recently met Malayalam superstar Mohanlal on the sets of 'Hridayapoorvam'. This sparked the actor's cameo in 'Jailer 2'.

Fighter's fight begins: Rajinikanth supports India's Operation SindoorSuperstar Rajinikanth reacted to India's mission against Pakistan-backed terrorism, code-named Operation Sindoor. He wrote that the entire nation is with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Total justice: Akshay Kumar to Kangana Ranaut, celebs on Operation SindoorOn May 7, India launched Operation Sindoor, attacking nine terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Several Bollywood celebrities, including Akshay Kumar, Kangana Ranaut and Suniel Shetty, among others, have reacted to the mission.

Kabir Khan opens up about creative differences with Salman Khan during Ek Tha Tiger shootDirector Kabir Khan shared insights into the challenges faced while working with Salman Khan on the set of 'Ek Tha Tiger'. He revealed that the film wasn't entirely under his control due to creative differences.

general news.headline: Indicate left, turn right: PM Modi's art of deception Pakistan failed to noticeBefore both Balakot and "Operation Sindoor", PM Modi kept public appearances routine, speeches calm, and intent hidden — masking precision strikes behind a poker face that Pakistan failed to read twice.

Pakistan ready to back down? Minister's tone-shift after Operation SindoorHours after vowing a forceful response to India's military strikes, Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif left room for dialogue, saying Islamabad would "wrap up" tensions if New Delhi backs down.

Over 200 flights cancelled, 18 airports shut after India strikes Pak terror campsAir traffic disruptions rippled across Asia as India's retaliatory strikes in Pakistan and POK led to the shutdown of 18 airports and cancellation of over 200 flights across domestic and international sectors.

Scalp, Hammer: Why these were India's weapons of choice to hit Pak terror campsOperation Sindoor: Rafale jets armed with SCALP cruise missiles and HAMMER precision-guided munitions were used for the strikes on terror camps in Pakistan.

Operation Sindoor is unique, it hit at the heart of PakistanOperation Sindoor is unique because it hit terror camps, including those in the heart of Pakistan, in its Punjab province. This is the first time since the 1971 War that India has hit targets in Pakistan's Punjab, and destroyed four terror camps in a 25-minute operation.

Who are officers Sofiya Qureshi and Vyomika Singh who briefed on Operation Sindoor?Col. Sofia Qureshi and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh led the press briefing after Operation Sindoor, sending a strong message to enemies of India. Here we look at who they are, what they have achieved, and how their growing roles reflect the rising power of women in India's armed forces.

Here's proof. Video shows Jaish headquarters turned to rubble in Indian strikesIndian Today TV exclusively accessed visuals of the damaged Subhan Allah camp in Pakistan's Bahawalpur, which served as the den of terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed, behind deadly attacks such as the 2001 Parliament and 2019 Pulwama attacks.

This is bare minimum: Congress leader questions impact of Operation SindoorWhile the Congress leadership was unanimous in praising the armed forces for Operation Sindoor, Congress leader Rashid Alvi struck a discordant note.

From 1947 war to Operation Sindoor: Tracing India-Pak's history of clashesOperation Sindoor highlights the volatile history of armed conflicts between India and Pakistan, a relationship shaped by a series of violent encounters and border skirmishes since their independence in 1947.

No terror camps in Pak? Journalist fact-checks minister on air after India strikesPakistani I&B Minister Attaullah Tarar was challenged by journalist Yalda Hakim on live television after claiming there are no terror camps in Pakistan.

Proud moment for all of us, PM told cabinet colleagues after Op Sindoor: SourcesOperation Sindoor: PM Modi congratulated the armed forces for their precision strikes on nine terror camps in Pakistan and PoK, calling it a proud moment for everyone, sources said.

4 drones came...everything destroyed: Pak eyewitness recounts India's strikesA local from Pakistan, speaking about India's strikes, said four drones came and attacked a mosque. 'Everything got destroyed,' he said.

Operation Sindoor: In the name is India's message, both humane and heroicIndia hit terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK) in pre-dawn strikes on Wednesday. It named it Operation Sindoor. Not just the strikes, even the name of the mission is supposed to convey a message to the world.

India's Rafale vs Pak's F-16: Air power in focus after Operation SindoorThe success of Operation Sindoor reveals a clear technological and operational edge for India when India's Rafale and Pakistan's F-16 series jets are put head to head.

PM Modi named it Operation Sindoor. Here's whyIn a coordinated tri-service strike, India hit nine terror targets in Pakistan and POK under 'Operation Sindoor', personally named by PM Modi to honour widows of the April 22 Pahalgam attack.

Camp where Kasab, Headley trained hit. Significance of the 9 Op Sindoor targetsThe armed forces explained point-by-point why the nine sites in Pakistan were targeted and their links between the targets and Pakistan-based terrorist groups.

Uri, Pulwama, and now Pahalgam: India's message to Pak is loud and clearJust 15 days after the Pahalgam terror attack, India carried out strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and POK. Previously, India had launched similar operations in 2016 following the Uri attack, and in 2019 in response to the Pulwama attack.

Funded by bin Laden, trained Ajmal Kasab: Why India hit LeT's Muridke MarkazEstablished in 2000 and allegedly funded in part by Osama bin Laden with a contribution of Rs 10 million, the Masjid wa Markaz Taiba in Pakistan's Muridke is central to the Hafiz Saeed-led terror outfit's operations.

Operation Sindoor: Should Dalal Street investors worry about what's next?There was no sell-off, no bloodbath, just a bit of volatility. For many retail investors, the calm felt unusual — shouldn't a military flare-up between nuclear neighbours spook the markets? But past data suggests otherwise.

Calculated, measured show of force: How foreign media reported Operation SindoorWhile Operation Sindoor was a significant military operation, it was equally a strategic exercise in shaping global perception. Most international media echoed the Indian stance that this was a calibrated counter-terror strike rather than an act of aggression.

Karan Johar says he's battling body dysmorphia: Can't even look myself in mirrorKaran Johar spoke about having insecurities with his body. He said he has a condition which makes him dislike his own body, but he's aware of the issues and working on them.

Military strikes in Pak regrettable: China urges both sides to remain calmChina has termed India's airstrikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir 'regrettable' and urged both sides to exercise restraint and avoid further escalation.

Indian airspace being monitored, it's a national emergency: Government sourcesFollowing India's retaliatory strikes on terror targets in Pakistan and POK, flight operations at five northern airports have been suspended, triggering widespread travel disruptions.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

sports.headline: IPL 2025: PBKS vs MI match likely to be shifted out of DharamsalaThe Match 61 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), scheduled to be played between Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Mumbai Indians (MI) is likely to be shifted following the closure of the Dharamsala airport.

PSG vs Arsenal, Champions League semifinal: Live streaming, predicted line-upArsenal will visit France to take on French champions Paris Saint Germain in the second leg of the UEFA Champions League semifinal in Paris. The winner of this tie will meet Inter Milan in the Champions League final.

IND v SA tri-series: Jemimah Rodrigues hits 2nd ODI hundred, joins elite listTri-series in Sri Lanka: Jemimah Rodrigues pulled off a guitar celebration after hitting her second ODI hundred in the match against South Africa in Colombo on May 7. She became the 7th Indian batter to hit more than a hundred in women's ODIs.

Ideal leader Shubman Gill thriving in IPL, says GT coach Parthiv PatelGujarat Titans assistant Parethiv Patel said that Shubman Gill is thriving in the leadership role in IPL 2025. After 11 matches, Shubman's GT are at the top of the table.

Dharamsala airport closure impacts Mumbai Indians' travel plansMumbai Indians' travel to Dharamsala for their IPL 2025 match against Punjab Kings has been delayed due to the closure of the local airport amid heightened security. The May 8 fixture between Delhi Capitals and Punjab Kings will go ahead as scheduled.

IPL 2025 to continue as scheduled amid India-Pakistan tensions: SourcesThe Indian Premier League will continue as scheduled amid the escalating tension between India and Pakistan, an indian cricket board source said. 14 more matches, including the final, is set to be played in the next three weeks.

Sachin Tendulkar, Shikhar Dhawan praise India's Operation SindoorSachin Tendulkar and Shikhar Dhawan showed strong support after Indian forces launched a coordinated attack on terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

Inconsistent KKR eye late playoffs charge vs woeful ChennaiIPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders need to win all their games to make it to the playoffs this season. They face Chennai Super Kings at home, a team that has already been knocked out this season.

IPL playoffs qualification scenarios: Can Mi top table despite losing to GT?IPL 2025: Mumbai Indians can qualify for the playoffs despite losing their 12th match to Gujarat Titans on Tuesday. The five-time champions can even finish in the top two.

Hardik Pandya, Ashish Nehra fined for breaching IPL Code of Conduct in thrillerMumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya was fined Rs. 24 lakh for his team's second slow over-rate offense of the season, while Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra was fined 25% of his match fees and handed a demerit point for conduct deemed "contrary to the spirit of the game."

MI will treat every game as playoffs now: Mahela JayawardeneMumbai Indians lost to Gujarat Titans in a rain-affected game on Tuesday. The loss complicated Mumbai's  chances of qualifying for the IPL playoffs.

Sachin Tendulkar, Shikhar Dhawan praise India's Operation SindoorSachin Tendulkar and Shikhar Dhawan showed strong support after Indian forces launched a coordinated attack on terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

Inconsistent KKR eye late playoffs charge vs woeful ChennaiIPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders need to win all their games to make it to the playoffs this season. They face Chennai Super Kings at home, a team that has already been knocked out this season.

IPL playoffs qualification scenarios: Can Mi top table despite losing to GT?IPL 2025: Mumbai Indians can qualify for the playoffs despite losing their 12th match to Gujarat Titans on Tuesday. The five-time champions can even finish in the top two.

Hardik Pandya, Ashish Nehra fined for breaching IPL Code of Conduct in thrillerMumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya was fined Rs. 24 lakh for his team's second slow over-rate offense of the season, while Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra was fined 25% of his match fees and handed a demerit point for conduct deemed "contrary to the spirit of the game."

MI will treat every game as playoffs now: Mahela JayawardeneMumbai Indians lost to Gujarat Titans in a rain-affected game on Tuesday. The loss complicated Mumbai's  chances of qualifying for the IPL playoffs.

Mumbai Indians must win both games to control their destiny in IPL 2025: KumbleFormer India captain and coach Anil Kumble has explained the qualification scenarios for both Mumbai Indians (MI) and Gujarat Titans (GT) after the rain-marred IPL 2025 thriller at the Wankhede.

Hardik Pandya not bowling final over can cost MI place in playoff: Sunil GavaskarIndia great Sunil Gavaskar has slammed Mumbai Indians' captain Hardik Pandya for giving the final over to Deepak Chahar after GT secured a three-wicket win under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern (DLS) method to go on top of the IPL points table.

Operation Sindoor: Gambhir welcomes India's strikes on Pakistan terror campsThe cricketing fraternity of India showed strong support after India conducted precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir at midnight on May 7. Operation Sindoor is estimated to have eliminated 80 terrorists through coordinated attacks.

Hansi Flick fumes over refereeing decisions after Champions League exitBarcelona's Champions League journey ended after a dramatic semi-final defeat against Inter Milan. Controversial referee decisions sparked outrage amongst Barcelona fans including coach Hansi Flick.

MI vs GT: Sunil Gavaskar honours Shubman Gill with Player of the Match for captaincyIn a rain-affected thriller at Wankhede, Shubman Gill showcased maturity with the bat and sharp leadership on the field to steer Gujarat Titans to a narrow three-wicket DLS win over Mumbai Indians, ending their six-match winning streak.

Hardik Pandya rues multiple no-balls in MI's loss to GT: A crime in T20sMI skipper Hardik Pandya rued the multiple no-balls his side bowled during their loss to GT at the Wankhede stadium on Tuesday, May 6. MI's winning streak was halted by GT, who moved to the top of the table.

Champions League: Inter Milan break Barcelona hearts in thriller, reach finalInter Milan reached the Champions League final after a dramatic 4-3 extra-time win over Barcelona, in the semi-final second leg at San Siro. Late goals from Francesco Acerbi and Davide Frattesi completed Inter's comeback on a night of high drama.

Hansi Flick fumes over refereeing decisions after Champions League exitBarcelona's Champions League journey ended after a dramatic semi-final defeat against Inter Milan. Controversial referee decisions sparked outrage amongst Barcelona fans including coach Hansi Flick.

MI vs GT: Sunil Gavaskar honours Shubman Gill with Player of the Match for captaincyIn a rain-affected thriller at Wankhede, Shubman Gill showcased maturity with the bat and sharp leadership on the field to steer Gujarat Titans to a narrow three-wicket DLS win over Mumbai Indians, ending their six-match winning streak.

Hardik Pandya rues multiple no-balls in MI's loss to GT: A crime in T20sMI skipper Hardik Pandya rued the multiple no-balls his side bowled during their loss to GT at the Wankhede stadium on Tuesday, May 6. MI's winning streak was halted by GT, who moved to the top of the table.

Champions League: Inter Milan break Barcelona hearts in thriller, reach finalInter Milan reached the Champions League final after a dramatic 4-3 extra-time win over Barcelona, in the semi-final second leg at San Siro. Late goals from Francesco Acerbi and Davide Frattesi completed Inter's comeback on a night of high drama.

IPL 2025: GT win rain-affected thriller to hurt MI's playoff hopesIn a rain-curtailed thriller at Wankhede, Gujarat Titans edged past Mumbai Indians via DLS, snapping MI's winning streak. Despite GT's top-order brilliance, it was Rahul Tewatia and Gerald Coetzee who sealed the tense final-over win under pressure.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli for England Tests? BCCI secretary shares selection updateIndia tour of England: The squad for the five-Test series in England is set to be announced before the final of IPL 2025, BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia said. The five-Test series will get underway from June 20.

Jos Buttler emulates MS Dhoni with sensational run-out in MI vs GTIPL 2025: Jos Buttler stunned fans with a Dhoni-style no-look run out against MI, showcasing his exceptional wicketkeeping skills and adding yet another highlight to a standout IPL 2025 campaign with the Gujarat Titans.

MI vs GT: Rashid Khan says he is still at 75 percent after fine spellGT spinner Rashid Khan says he is still at 75 percent after a fine spell against MI on Tuesday, May 6. Rashid had struggled to find his rhythm in the early part of the IPL 2025 season.

IPL 2025 KKR vs CSK: MS Dhoni skips practice, but will play in Kolkata, says bowling coachIPL 2025, KKR vs CSK: Captain MS Dhoni will play Wednesday's game against Kolkata Knight Riders, confirmed Chennai Super Kings bowling coach Eric Simons. Dhoni did not train in the lead-up to the much-awaited game in Kolkata.

Rohit Sharma flops in Mumbai as Gujarat Titans' left-arm pace plan worksIPL 2025, MI vs GT: Gujarat Titans were rewarded for their tactical move to bring in Arshad Khan for their game in Mumbai. The left-arm pacer dismissed Rohit Sharma cheaply in the powerplay on Tuesday, May 6.

Sunil Gavaskar wants change in rule that accommodated Dhoni as uncapped playerSunil Gavaskar wants a change to the IPL rule that allowed MS Dhoni to be retained as an uncapped player by CSK ahead of the IPL 2025 auction. Dhoni was retained by Chennai for Rs. 4 Crore.

94 matches in an IPL season? Chairman Arun Dhumal confirms plans for league expansionIPL 2025: Speaking to India Today, Indian Premier League chairman Arun Dhumal said the BCCI will continue to follow the government's directives on cricket ties with Pakistan. He also confirmed that the BCCI is looking to expand the IPL to 94 matches by the 2028 season.

Gautam Gambhir breaks silence on Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma Test futuresIndia coach Gautam Gambhir has broken the silence on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test futures ahead of the tour of England. Rohit and Kohli's futures has been under the scanner since the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Nation first: IPL chief Arun Dhumal on cricket amid rising India-Pakistan tensionIPL chairman Arun Dhumal reaffirmed that Indian cricket will follow the government's lead on ties with Pakistan, emphasising "nation first" amid rising tensions in the aftermath of the Pahalgam attack. He also confirmed plans to expand the IPL to a 94-match season by 2028 while celebrating the emergence of new Indian talent in 2025.

India shouldn't play Pakistan in cricket till terrorism ends: Gautam GambhirAfter the Pahalgam terror attack, India coach Gautam Gambhir says there should be no cricket with Pakistan until peace is restored and justice is done, even if it means skipping ICC matches.

Kagiso Rabada return delayed: GT skipper Shubman Gill explains call for MI clashGT have decided not to rush Kagiso Rabada as the South African pacer was made to sit out the clash against MI at the Wankhede stadium on Tuesday, May 6. Rabada recently returned to GT squad after serving his suspension for a failed drug test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
